com.relevantcodes.extentreports

Class ExtentReports

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.relevantcodes.extentreports.ExtentReports

  • public class ExtentReports
extends java.lang.Object
    ExtentReports (by Anshoo Arora) is a HTML reporting library for Selenium WebDriver for Java which is extremely easy to use and creates beautiful execution reports. It shows test and step summary, test steps and status in a toggle view for quick analysis

    Project URL: http://relevantcodes.com/extentreports-for-selenium/

    Author:
    Anshoo Arora

      • get

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an ExtentReports object

      • startTest

        public void startTest(java.lang.String testName)
        Calling startTest(arg) generates a toggle for the test in the HTML file and adds all log events under this level. This is a required step and without calling this method the toggle will not be created for the test and the log events may not appear, or appear under an incorrect test.

        Usage: extent.startTest("MyTestName");

        Parameters:
        testName - Name of the test that is currently being run and report is being generated for

      • startTest

        public void startTest(java.lang.String testName,
                      java.lang.String testDescription)
        Calling startTest(arg, arg) generates a toggle for the test in the HTML file and adds all log events under this level. This is a required step and without calling this method the toggle will not be created for the test and the log events may not appear, or appear under an incorrect test.

        This overloaded method allows a description to be written for the testName.

        Usage: extent.startTest("Test - With Description", "This description will show up under Test.");

        Parameters:
        testName - Name of the test that is currently being run and report is being generated for
        testDescription - Description of the test

      • endTest

        public void endTest()
        Ends the current toggle level

      • log

        public void log(LogStatus logStatus,
                java.lang.String stepName,
                java.lang.String details,
                java.lang.String screenCapturePath)
        Provides ability to log events for each started test.

        Usage: extent.log(LogStatus.INFO, "Image", "Image example:", "C:\\img.png");

        It is possible to use relative path for the snapshot. Note: Relative paths starting with '/' and '.' are supported. If you are using an absolute path, 'file:///' will be automatically appended for the image to load correctly.

        Usage
        extent.log(LogStatus.INFO, "Image", "Image example:", "./pathToImg.png");
        extent.log(LogStatus.INFO, "Image", "Image example:", "/pathToImg.png");

        Parameters:
        logStatus - LogStatus of the log event
        stepName - Name of the step
        details - Details of the step
        screenCapturePath - Path of the snapshot to be attached to step

      • log

        public void log(LogStatus logStatus,
                java.lang.String stepName,
                java.lang.String details)
        Overloaded method to allow LogStatus, stepName and details for the log event

        Usage: extent.log(LogStatus.PASS, "StepName", "PASS Details");

        Parameters:
        logStatus - LogStatus of the log event
        stepName - Name of the step
        details - Details of the step

      • log

        public void log(LogStatus logStatus,
                java.lang.String details)
        Overloaded method to allow only setting the LogStatus and details of the log event

        Usage: extent.log(LogStatus.INFO, "This step shows usage of log(logStatus, details)");

        Parameters:
        logStatus - LogStatus of the log event
        details - Details of the step

      • attachScreenshot

        public void attachScreenshot(java.lang.String screenCapturePath,
                             java.lang.String message)
        Allows attaching a snapshot as a step.

        Usage: extent.attachScreenshot("pathToImg.png", "This step only attaches a screenshot without a status.");

        It is possible to use relative path for the snapshot. Note: Relative paths starting with '/' and '.' are supported. If you are using an absolute path, 'file:///' will be automatically appended for the image to load correctly.

        Parameters:
        screenCapturePath - Path of the snapshot file
        message - Message to attach for the step

      • attachScreenshot

        public void attachScreenshot(java.lang.String screenCapturePath)
        Allows attaching a snapshot as a step.

        Usage: extent.attachScreenshot("pathToImg.png");

        It is possible to use relative path for the snapshot. Note: Relative paths starting with '/' and '.' are supported. If you are using an absolute path, 'file:///' will be automatically appended for the image to load correctly.

        Parameters:
        screenCapturePath - Path of the snapshot file

      • setLogLevel

        public void setLogLevel(LogLevel logLevel)
        This allows a log level for the report. It filters any LogStatus that does not conform to the level set.

        ALLOW_ALL: default setting which passes all log events to the report
        FAIL: Allows FAIL and FATAL events sent to the report
        WARNING: Allows WARNING and FAIL events to be sent to the report
        ERROR: Allows ERROR and FAIL events to be sent to the report
        ERRORS_AND_WARNING: Allows Errors, Warnings and FAIL/FATAL events
        OFF: No events are allowed to be written to the report

        Parameters:
        logLevel - Level of logging to be used

      • config

        public DocumentConfig config()
        Returns the DocumentConfig object that allows various configurations to be applied to the report file
        Returns:
        DocumentConfig

      • init

        public void init(java.lang.String filePath,
                 java.lang.Boolean replaceExisting)
        Initializes the reporting by setting the file-path
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path of the file, in .htm or .html format
        replaceExisting - Setting to overwrite (TRUE) the existing file or append (FALSE) to it using the DisplayOrder order true: the file will be replaced with brand new markup, and all existing data will be lost. Use this option to create a brand new report false: existing data will remain, new tests will be appended to the existing report

      • init

        public void init(java.lang.String filePath,
                 java.lang.Boolean replaceExisting,
                 DisplayOrder displayOrder)
        Initializes the reporting by setting the file-path and test DisplayOrder
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path of the file, in .htm or .html format
        replaceExisting - Setting to overwrite (TRUE) the existing file or append (FALSE) to it using the DisplayOrder order true: the file will be replaced with brand new markup, and all existing data will be lost. Use this option to create a brand new report false: existing data will remain, new tests will be appended to the existing report
        displayOrder - Determines the order in which your tests will be displayed BY_OLDEST_TO_LATEST (default) - oldest test at the top, newest at the end BY_LATEST_TO_OLDEST - newest test at the top, oldest at the end

      • init

        public void init(java.lang.String filePath,
                 java.lang.Boolean replaceExisting,
                 GridType gridType)
        Initializes the reporting by setting the file-path and GridType
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path of the file, in .htm or .html format
        replaceExisting - Setting to overwrite (TRUE) the existing file or append (FALSE) to it using the DisplayOrder order true: the file will be replaced with brand new markup, and all existing data will be lost. Use this option to create a brand new report false: existing data will remain, new tests will be appended to the existing report
        gridType - Determines the type of grid to be used STANDARD (default) - standard grid with 1 test per row MASONRY - creates a masonry style grid with 2 tests per row

      • init

        public void init(java.lang.String filePath,
                 java.lang.Boolean replaceExisting,
                 DisplayOrder displayOrder,
                 GridType gridType)
        Initializes the reporting by setting the file-path, test DisplayOrder and GridType
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path of the file, in .htm or .html format
        replaceExisting - Setting to overwrite (TRUE) the existing file or append (FALSE) to it using the DisplayOrder order true: the file will be replaced with brand new markup, and all existing data will be lost. Use this option to create a brand new report false: existing data will remain, new tests will be appended to the existing report
        displayOrder - Determines the order in which your tests will be displayed BY_OLDEST_TO_LATEST (default) - oldest test at the top, newest at the end BY_LATEST_TO_OLDEST - newest test at the top, oldest at the end
        gridType - Determines the type of grid to be used STANDARD (default) - standard grid with 1 test per row MASONRY - creates a masonry style grid with 2 tests per row
